item.title: Kate add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kate add a quote by Andrew Davidson
item.description: "I understand that some people find God after misfortune, although this seems to me even more ridiculous than finding Him in good times. 'God smote me. He must love me.' It's like not wanting a romantic relationship until a member of the opposite sex punches you in the face. My 'miraculous survival' will not change my opinion that Heaven is an idea constructed by man to help him cope with the fact that life on earth is both brutally short, and paradoxically, far too long. " -- Andrew Davidson

item.title: Kate add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Kate add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Kate add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kate add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I always loved you, and if one loves anyone, one loves the whole person, just as they are and not as one would like them to be. -Dolly" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Kate add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Your memory is a monster; you forget—it doesn't. It simply files things away. It keeps things for you, or hides things from you—and summons them to your recall with will of its own. You think you have a memory; but it has you!" -- John Irving

item.title: Kate add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kate add a quote by Jim Harrison
item.description: "I like grit, I like love and death, I'm tired of irony. ... A lot of good fiction is sentimental. ... The novelist who refuses sentiment refuses the full spectrum of human behavior, and then he just dries up. ... I would rather give full vent to all human loves and disappointments, and take a chance on being corny, than die a smartass." -- Jim Harrison

item.title: Kate add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "It's quite an undertaking to start loving somebody. You have to have energy, generosity, blindness. There is even a moment right at the start where you have to jump across an abyss: if you think about it you don't do it." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Kate add a quote by Susan Cain
item.description: "(Finland is a famously introverted nation. Finnish joke: How can you tell if a Finn likes you? He's staring at your shoes instead of his own.)" -- Susan Cain

item.title: Kate add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kate add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Kate add a quote by Ethan Hawke
item.description: "Give your heart to everybody you meet. The rest is pretense." -- Ethan Hawke

item.title: Kate add a quote by Moli
item.description: "Writing is like prostitution. First you do it for love, and then for a few close friends, and then for money." -- Moli
